update.description:
Issue #402

Undo / redo:

* Inserting a new joint between links / nested models

* Deleting a joint which was inserted

* Deleting a joint which already existed in the model

* Deleting a link / nested model which has joints attached

* Deleting joints from the context menu in 3D scene or the palette

* Deleting joint from joint inspector

Obs: I moved `test/models/deeply_nested_model` to a folder and added a `model.config` so it can be shown in the insert tab.
update.title: Model Editor: Undo insert / delete joints

content.raw:
Can you explicitly assign values to these enums? The reason is mostly for knowledge sharing and debugging. If a user `printf` and instance of this enum the output will be a number. The can then cross reference the number with the doxygen documentation a bit more easily.

[Example from QT](http://doc.qt.io/qt-4.8/qwidget.html#RenderFlag-enum)
content.html:
Can you explicitly assign values to these enums? The reason is mostly for knowledge sharing and debugging. If a user printf and instance of this enum the output will be a number. The can then cross reference the number with the doxygen documentation a bit more easily.

Example from QT

content.raw:
just wondering if this is the expected behavior:

1. create a revolute joint

1. change type to prismatic

1. delete joint

1. undo 

1. redo -> revolute joint is created (not prismatic)
content.html:
just wondering if this is the expected behavior:

  1. create a revolute joint

  2. change type to prismatic

  3. delete joint

  4. undo

  5. redo -> revolute joint is created (not prismatic)
